intro: Senecio microtis, commonly known as the narrowleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in spring, and the plant is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Senecio microtis is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive foliage and blooms.
